title: David Tepper - Wikipedia
snippet: The team's lease on Bank of America Stadium expired after the 2018 season. In a statement, Tepper committed to keeping the team in the Carolinas. Since the start of his ownership in 2018, the Panthers had a losing record every season and 7 head coaches in that span.

title: This Day in Panthers History | Carolina Panthers - Panthers.com
snippet: The sale of the Carolina Panthers to David Tepper, the founder and president of global hedge fund Appaloosa Management, closes, and he officially acquires the franchise. Tepper buys the team from founder Jerry Richardson for $2.275 billion.
